Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: DerrickM72672
Reviews.Content: We were able to get an awesome rate for the labor day weekend and stayed at the Hall of Fame hotel/motel. Staff was friendly and very accommodating. There are lots of renovation going on and our room was clean and fresh and everything worked. The renovations in no way affected our stay. Housekeepers tended to our needs daily with fresh towels. Close enough to avoid traffic and walk to most shops. Pool was open and refreshing and the boys loved watching the helicopter take off and land onsite. Breakfast was good and hot not a cereal only breakfast. We were even able to catch a free concert on the landing. Will definitely be staying here again and recommend this place to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dirty”
Reviews.Author: TRP777
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the condos at this hotel. The front desk gentlemen were nice and friendly, the breakfast was good, it was in a great location, and the pool, although we didn't swim, appeared to be nice and clean. The horrible part was the cleanliness of the condo. Upon our arrival, we discovered hair all over the bathroom floor, pink and black mildew in the toilet bowl, and the carpet was disgusting. Our socks and feet were literally black from walking around. Luckily, I had packed a pack of Clorox wipes and wiped the place down, but of course that didn't help with the carpet. We arrived just after 9 pm and we didn't feel like complaining-we had a tired toddler and we were both tired as well. We figured we'd just deal with it for two days and be done with it. What really got me was that after the housekeeping service came, we arrived to find an envelope on top of the fireplace from the housekeepers, Bill and Luann, saying, "Thanks for staying with us...." and all that. At the bottom of the envelope was a word that had been marked out, but not very well. I was able to make out the word "tip." They expected us to leave a tip with this type of housekeeping?!? No. I complained to the front desk when checking out. I filled out a complaint form and they said they would forward the info to the GM, who should be giving me a call to see if they could "make things right." This was three days ago, and I have yet to hear from anyone. Needless to say, our family will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever at Hall of Fame”
Reviews.Author: wccardinalfan
Reviews.Content: We was at HOF July 20-22nd for a family get away. Our family has been staying here for years, my wife and I make all the reservations for these trips. This trip we had 4 condos and 11 rooms. The staff was horrible!!!!! The desk clerk was RUDE. Rooms not cleaned, no towels. toilet paper, I understand having to ask for this once in a while but this was with every room we had family in. After the 100th time of using the tornado as a excuse I told them I was sick of hearing it as we are from Joplin MO and I have not heard anyone here whining about the tornado like these people was. This was the only place I heard anyone use the tornado as a excuse in Branson. No excuse for not taking care of your customers. If we treated our customers at the company I work for like this we would be out of business and we have customers all over the world. We have been making this trip with family members for several years at least twice a year. I complained and asked for the GM to call me or e-mail me, I tried to contact them again and seems that one family bringing in almost $2000 in one weekend is not a big deal to them. Sad because this has always been our family's favorite place to stay. Now we will be looking for somewhere else to take our business as long as they have the staff they have now. I just feel sorry for Dave, a long time employee that was very upset with the way we was treated. The desk clerk started yelling at me in the parking lot because I was complaining. What he didn't know is it takes a lot for me to complain. After recemending this motel for several years we will no longer be doing that.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: hckmnmry
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Branson (July 30-Aug 1, 2012) and we stayed at this property; yes the tornado damage from earlier in the year is noticeable and a couple of the buildings on the property are under reconstruction and or renovation but we were not impacted by it. Before we made our reservation, we called the property to inquire about any tornado damage, and they were up front about it and described what was and wasn't affected by it. The construction workers were very nice and considerate to the hotel patrons. The staff is hospitable, our room 6201 was one of the condo's that is offered. It was very big, clean, comfortable and quiet. Although we did not use the outdoor pool, it appeared to be open and looked very inviting and clean. This hotel is right on the main strip in the middle of it all; which is very convenient. Once the reconstruction and renovations are complete this hotel will be good as new again. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: FelFen
Reviews.Content: During our visit this past weekend, we experienced some things at the Hall of Fame Motel that were rather disappointing. Due to the tornado that came through Branson in February of this year, this hotel was partially under construction. This is understandable and acceptable. However, what is not acceptable is the fact that the hotel is not advertised to be that way. The website, as well as the brochure we were handed with our room keys, states there is a full service restaurant and bar on the premises. The restaurant was destroyed and demolished, leaving behind a concrete slab on the site. Where the restaurant used to be there were no barricades of any kind, and the parking lot is poorly lit at night. We felt this was dangerous. We stayed for two nights in a king bed condo, with a kitchenette, jacuzzi, double shower, and lots of space. The room was of average cleanliness and comfort. The jacuzzi would not drain, so my husband had to stand holding the drain open until all the water was drained. The toilet would hang up occasionally when flushed, and we ran out of hot water in the shower one day. We did not receive any housekeeping while there, so we got no fresh linens or refills on coffee supplies. The sign posted on the pool stated it closed at 11pm. We got to the pool after 9:30. My husband and I were the only ones in the pool, when management drove by and told us the pool would close at 10pm and that the sign was there from the previous management. (Umm...change your sign, please.) The brochure we received at check-in, containing our room keys, stated the lobby closed at 11pm. The lobby closed at 10pm. No one was there to assist. When we arrived at the hotel, we were not told where breakfast was held. We still don't know if the fitness center is on-site, as stated, because no one mentioned that either. Check-in was inconvenient. We had made reservations with a credit card online. When we got there, they had to re-enter the credit card information. Check-in took much longer than at other hotels. There was no one in the lobby when we went in to check out. After waiting for several minutes, one of the staff happened to walk in. She called management to ask what needed to be done. The breakfast area was probably the best part of the place - we found it on our own, simply by guessing where it was, no sign or anything. Decorated in a 50's Americana theme, there is plenty of seating at the booths and tables. TV's are present, and the biscuits and gravy were hot, fresh, and delicious. The only problem we had was that management began stacking chairs and putting away food 15 minutes before breakfast ended. We overheard that the hotel is currently under-staffed, as several employees walked out. This would explain some of the issues we encountered and why management was tending to breakfast and even some of the cleaning. Maybe all of these issues are why they have been offering discounted rates, but it doesn't excuse the misinformation or poor maintenance of existing rooms. We will not be back to this one, unless major improvements are made. We felt we overpaid for what we got, even with the lower rates, especially considering the dishonesty. Our stay was still an enjoyable one, because we chose not to let these inconveniences get to us. The hotel is in a location convenient to many of the amenities that Branson has to offer, as it is on the main strip. If they continue to work on the hotel, I think it could be a really nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Honesty is the best policy.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGranny0912
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hall of Fame Hotel this year for vacation. We could not have asked for better service. Not to mention because we were celebrating our 32nd wedding anniversary, we had chocolate covered strawberries, a balloon, anniversary cake and non-alcohol champagne. BUT when we go on vacation the one thing that I must have is an outside pool. I like to relax poolside while reading, etc. When I called to reserve our room, I specifically asked “do you have an outside pool”. The manager said yes, he failed to mention that the outside pool was not in operation because of the tornado. If I had anything to complain about it would be they were not honest about the pool. When we arrived, I was so upset, we had paid cash in advance, I demanded our money back, they were more than willing to refund our money but asked if they could upgrade us “at no charge” to a condo. Let me tell you, the condo was so nice, we could not have asked for anything better. On a scale of 1-10, 10 being perfect, I would rate their condo an 8. Everything was great, I just asked that they be honest when asked specific questions. I understand that they feel they might loose business if they tell the consumer their pool is out of commission, but isn’t it the consumer’s right to be told the truth? WE WILL DEFINITELY STAY AT THE HALL OF FAME HOTEL again IF THE POOL IS IN OPERATION.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great price!”
Reviews.Author: Heather F
Reviews.Content: First, because of tornado damage the place doesn't look great and some of the rooms are obviously not available and the resteraunt that was on site is no longer standing... but goodness! The room was perfect. Clean. Nice beds. And a mini fridge! NICE! They also have breakfast... real breakfast with biscuits and gravy, cereal, hot fresh coffee, bagels, donuts and more. We had to ask where it was, but its there. Hidden, but it an area set up like a little diner. The service was amazing! We needed extra bath towels and litterly only waited 2 minutes! The room was about $55 - totally worth it and more! The only bad thing (which I didn't call ahead to check, so its my fault) was the pool wasn't open. Tornado damage I'm sure, but we were looking forward to a dip in the pool after spending time in the 90+ degree heat. But everything else made up for it... plus its right in the middle of town, across the street from the wax museum. GREAT LOCATION. We were very satisfied in our stay and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A place to lay your head... but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: MissouriBusyMomOfTwo
Reviews.Content: This season our family has Silver Dollar City and White Water Season passes. So, we thought, living an hour and a half away -- we would look for good, clean, cheaper hotels to stay a night -- so we wouldn't have to drive back home. A tank of gas is about what we'd spend on a hotel room (or so we thought) for these frequent trips. I went online, and of course, didn't reserve my hotel room quick enough for the Memorial Day holiday weekend, but found this Hall of Fame Hotel to be reasonable ($61 for one night). We thought we'd try it just to say we tried it. We paid online, check in was smooth, they had our reservation ready and room keys, manager was nice, showed us where to park and where to get breakfast the next morning. As we pulled down the hill -- immediately we noticed lots of tornado damage still present. We realize the tornado just happened this spring, so that didn't bother us. (we live near Joplin, MO, so seeing tornado damage isn't new to us) It would have been nice if the hotel would have reported online that the pool was still out of commission -- that was one thing we thought we'd do in the evening after dinner. We opened our room -- seemed okay, a little dated on the decor. AC worked, albeit it was a window unit. We had to ask for more towels, family of 4 with 3 towels, 1 washcloth. Stains in the sink, cobwebs at the lights above the sink -- but bathroom, toilet, and shower was clean. Sheets were clean. Towels smelled fresh. Carpet was stained, but vacuumed. I slept in earplugs due to the noise of the AC, and people around us -- but that is something I have to do anytime I'm in a hotel room. Husband slept fine, and kids slept fine too. Our boy ended up sick from our trip to Silver Dollar City, so we did not head to White Water the following day. We checked out in the morning a few hours prior to the check out time. We did not eat the breakfast, as he was sick and we needed to get home. So I cannot give any feedback about the breakfast offered. Check out was smooth and friendly. Again, a place to lay our head after a day at Silver Dollar City, but we probably wont be staying on the cheapest end of our budget next time we come. I think we will budget up a few more dollars to stay in a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our second stay!”
Reviews.Author: Casper1958
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at Hall Of Fame for the second time, and it was as nice the second time as the first. The Hospitality by the staff was just great! We saw the devastation from the Tornado and it did some damage to parts of the Motel, but it was still open. It was a home for some people that had displaced from the tornado. Just a very nice place to stay. Charlies steak house was great the first time we we're there, but, it was closed this time due to damage from the tornado.

Reviews.Title: “Got to give them credit”
Reviews.Author: IdrivealotMaine
Reviews.Content: The Hall of Fame, along with a large number of hotels in Branson, was recently hit by a serious tornado. I have to give them credit for being open and giving a superior level of service. At this time (early April 2012), some of the buildings are open, some are not. Through it all, the staff is more than happy to help get tickets, set up tours, etc. The breakfast, is going strong. Biscuits and gravy, cereal, pastry, yoghurt, etc. I wouldn't hesitate a minute to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay...”
Reviews.Author: marina t
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel/motel. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We asked for more pillows and they were brought right away. One day we were late for breakfast and they opened the door back up to serve us. Staff is very friendly and the service is very good. If we ever go to Branson again, we would stay at the Hall of fame again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Great Hotel; Excellent bargain”
Reviews.Author: billarsenault
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The people are very friendly. It is an excellent value. Very good breakfast. Close to Charlie's which has excellent food and great specials.

Reviews.Title: “HELL on EARTH...”
Reviews.Author: sl4985
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I am having to write this. I am not a negative person, at all. I hate reading negative reviews, and I am not getting any enjoyment from writing this one. Please do not stay at this hotel. I have NEVER in my ENTIRE LIFE had such a bad experience. Our first room was fine... the staff was not friendly while checking us in but they were not rude either. Our van broke down the evening we arrived, and even though we were supposed to depart the next day, the young lady at the front desk said we could stay a few hours later at no cost. A few hours later, we received a call from the manager saying "Come get your stuff out of your room, right now". Yes, she said EXACTLY that. I didn't know who it was, or what they were even talking about at first. After I realized it was the hotel, I was like what in the world is going on? We were trying to get our car repaired, had no way to get back to the hotel. It was awful. I told her we would take another night, as the woman earlier told me to tell her by 1PM if we wanted another night - we told her at noon that we did. She said oh well, they overbooked, so there were NO open rooms for us. She said we needed to get our stuff out immediately. It was 107 degrees out on this day, and I walked back to start packing our stuff. I was going to have to walk, with 3 kids in 107 degree heat, to another hotel. While I was packing, the manager came and told me I could stay in another room. I was so relieved, I almost hugged her - even though she had been so rude. We moved everything to our new room, and just wanted to rest. The fold out couch was broken, so the kids had to sleep on the floor. No big deal, we were thankful to have a roof over our head at this point. Went to the bathroom and it was practically flooded. Apparently the toilet had a leak. The shower would not give us any hot water. When we called the front desk to let them know about the toilet and the couch, a DRUNK (yes drunk) maintenance man came to "fix" it. He tried to pull the couch out and almost fell over. He smelled like a bar. It was horrible. We told him to forget it, just so he would leave. We thought everything was fine until this morning. I was called to the front desk last night at 8PM but I told them I would come up in the morning (it was for payment for the rest of our stay) because I was in my pajamas, putting my girls to bed. When I went up there this morning, the young girl at the front desk YELLED at us because the hotel received an email from a concerned friend that I had told about our experience. She slammed the paper down on the table (the printed out email) and started yelling about how her other customers bought her expensive jewelry because she's so great, but here we are complaining about them. I apologized, I said I did not email them or tell anyone to, and it was a misunderstanding. She yelled some more and told us to GET OUT. I told her I just wanted to pay for our room and go get breakfast. She continued to YELL until I told her to get her manager. Manager showed up and took my payment. She wasn't quite as rude as she was before, she just said she didn't appreciate being contacted by others on my behalf. I told her again that I did not tell anyone to contact them, it was obviously just a concerned friend because our experience was so bad. Please NEVER stay at this hotel, it really is HELL ON EARTH. I have never had such a bad experience in my life. Not only is the hotel room nasty, musty, and leaky, the customer service is HORRIBLE! I will be warning EVERYONE about this place!! Go a few doors down and get a cheaper hotel with better customer service, I guarantee it.

Reviews.Title: “So-So.”
Reviews.Author: obijuana
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Sunday night and had planned to stay for a few days, but our room didn't have a fridge or microwave. They moved us to a different room the next day that suited us. Beds were surprisingly comfortable. Ancient tv. Bathroom was decent. Plenty of hot water. AC was cold, which was a must since it was like Africa hot in Branson our whole stay. The soda machine on our floor took our money. The room wasn't fancy, but it was clean. You want fancy...stay at the Hilton. You want some place to sleep while between running around town then stay some place affordable. The only real negative I give this place was the pool. On Monday the pool was closed because the staff had to "shock" the pool to kill off something in the water. Other than that the pool was great. This is an average motel with average amenities. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Last second trip”
Reviews.Author: K_P6977
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay the night before and this was the first rooms we found after searching for a few hours. While it was clean , this is an older motel and the staff acted as if they could care less. It's not like anyone wasn't doing their jobs , it's just that only one worker even talked to us for any reason. That included check-in when the lady didn't say a single word while checking us in. Back to the motel. Room is typical older motel room style. Air worked great ! ( Very hot here in July) Only extra in room is small blow dryer. No fridge , ironing board , safe. Small TV. Pool was nice and kept clean. They provide a hot breakfast that is actually very good (and has the one very nice worker). Overall I'd say the motel was adequate for a short stay but there are better options if you plan ahead. Best thing about this motel is that it's next door to Charlie's Steak and Ale , the best place in Branson !

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Can't Complain!!”
Reviews.Author: Okra876
Reviews.Content: I'm not really sure why anyone would give this place a bad review. The rate was super cheap. 2 nights for under $100.00 and we were told that if we stayed longer the rate would be even cheaper. Great customer service, very friendly! The rooms were very spacious and clean. Much larger than the chain hotels. The TV was a little small, but we don't watch a lot of TV on vacation, so who cares. It was color, had a remote control, and cable; who needs more? It was HOT outside being July, but the air conditioner worked great and the room stayed nice and cool the whole time. The pool was one of the best I have used as far as hotels go. It was Private (off the road), had perfect water temp., very clean, and big! They provided nice shampoo and conditioner, coffee maker in room, and free continental breakfast. The location is great with a restaurant and bar attached ("Charlie's", the food and drinks were wonderful!) and walking distance to all kinds of places to eat and drink (adult beverages too!). Right across the street from the wax museum and walking distance to several other attractions including the Titanic. Pet friendly for a one time fee of $25.00 per stay (not per dog not per night. yay!). We took our two mutts and they had a great time walking the strip and had plenty of well-lit grassy walk-ways on the hotel's grounds to use the restroom. Again, not sure why anyone would give this place a bad review. For the money, I don't think it can be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel, find another if you want to enjoy your vacation”
Reviews.Author: thaddeus333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on dec 22, 23. This place is a dump, rooms are filthy, service sucks. We started out in one room and the heater wouldn;t work, they sent out a repairman and he simply turned the heater to cool and then back to heat and said " give it some time." Well an hour later still no heat. So they transfered us to another room, still no working heater. So then they transfered us to another room where the hot water ran out in 3 minutes, the jacuzzi tub ran yellow pee colored water. DO NOT STAY HERE, THERE ARE MANY OTHER NICER PACES OF EQUAL OR BETTER PRICE. SPEND YOUR MONEY AND TIME AT A BETTER LOCATION!

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay there again unless a lot of work is done there”
Reviews.Author: Sam1235
Reviews.Content: My husband and sister and I went on the trip to Branson. In our room one of the beds about fell in. Vanity had burn holes. Water took 10 minutes to get hot. Door did not always lock when we went out. Adjoining door did not lock at all. In adjoining room heater came on when ever it wanted to even if you shut it off. We told the staff when we left and got a we are sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Grody Motel”
Reviews.Author: MrsMusic28
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Hall of Fame Motel in Branson. The name makes you think it's going to be fairly nice, but it's not. I mean if you are looking for a place that you can lay your head, shower, and get ready, it's okay - but if you are looking for comfort and a place that makes you feel safe walking on the floors without shoes, look else where!! We were in a non-smoking room, but the room had evidences of past smoking added with grody motel smell. One bed looked broken and very low to the floor, but slept okay. The soap and shampoo were stinky and the towels were rough. They did have an elevator, but it smelled like smoke and kind of like the subway. They do have a complimentary breakfast which was okay. Hot biscuits and canned gravy with sausage in it. My Froot Loops were stale, but it was free! Anyway, like I said, if you're not too picky this place is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: VariantLandscape
Reviews.Content: This was a reunion to our honeymoon spot. Some would call it a baldnobber wedding but I however reminised on the fantastic time I had with my wife and am still having with her. We aren't hoity toity types. In fact I dig ditches. lol. I can afford the hilton or chateau or big cedar, but this is where it happened. This place will always be 5 star to me, even though I know it is not. It is worth ever dollar to a man that knows his means. We live a much higher life now but we know our roots, in which I think alot of people should come back to contact with.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price, great location and super clean!”
Reviews.Author: stperpetua7
Reviews.Content: I gave Hall of Fame a 5 star not because its a 5 star hotel, but for a hotel in this price range, it exceeded all of our expectations. My husband and I decided to stay in Branson last minute and thought that any motels that still had vacancy would be flea bags...not this one! They had a "walk in special" sign posted which was $55 a night for 2 double beds. Not sure what their regular price is. We stayed in a smoke free room on the lower level with 2 queen beds with a military rate of $44, including tax!! This included a free hot breakfast and outdoor pool (we'll get to that later). The room smelled very fresh and was super clean! With a room so cheap I wouldnt have expected any type of amenities but the bathroom had Finesse shampoo/cond., soap, and even a moist make-up remover cloth. The room had a coffee pot with reg, decaf and condiments. I'm 7 months pregnant and was sure the beds would be hard and I'd have a bad night sleep but they weren't at all! I mean, they weren't pillow-top but comfortable enough, as well as the pillows. The TV picture was perfectly clear and had tons of channels. The air conditioner worked wonderfully, not loud, no smells. Great water pressure (I actually had to turn it down a little) and plenty of hot water. We really appreciated Charlie's Steakhouse that shared the same parking lot...took seconds to get there. The ribeyes we had were great, the sides just ok. I thought I'd hate the live singer they had but it was quiet enough and she had a great voice, so we actually enjoyed it! My husband enjoyed the micro brews they make there...the light wheat. I would recommend eating there if you're staying at Hall of Fame. The pool was a perfect temperature, had pool towels stocked, very clean, not busy at all despite it being peak season and was open until 11pm. We really enjoyed swimming after dinner. Something we thought was really cool about the location of our room was that when you step outside your door and look to the right, a giant King Kong is right there across the street on top of the wax museum...something our kids would have loved. The breakfast ended at 9am but they were still accomodating to the stragglers coming in exactly at 9am. Its really just and extended cont. breakfast but satisfied us enough...and remember, I'm pregnant! It had biscuits and gravy, hot and cold cereals, donuts, yogurt and canned fruit cocktail, breads, coffee, milk and juice...but all free. I was impressed by the hospitality of the employees and also the fact that we constantly seen them around the grounds on golf carts, taking care of things. Check out time was at 11am but we called the front desk for an 11:30am check out and it wasn't a problem. This place really was perfect for the price and great for a cheap getaway in a clean place in a great location! We already have reservations next weekend w/ them but this time we're taking the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: happy_guest82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hall of Fame... the rooms where clean... beds comfortable.. the pool was relaxing... the housekeeping staff where funny and wonderful.... When I ask about all the bad reviews they said they just changed staff... New general management and maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating and down home friendliness”
Reviews.Author: JardelinaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hall of Fame in Branson the week before Memorial Day. We found the staff to be very friendly and willing to accommodate our desires which makes a holiday perfect. Special kudos to Shannon at the Breakfast Room. She welcomed everyone who came into her kitchen and kept the Breakfast area very neat. She was also very friendly and truly cared about everyone. Also Charley's Steakhouse on site is a wonderful place to eat and have some fun.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, going back soon!”
Reviews.Author: kattidid
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the condo and everything worked great. Very clean, kitchen well stocked and the jacuzzi was wonderful. Nice patio with chairs and peaceful surroundings. The "breakfast" tasted fine, could have been a better selection. The only "complaint" I have: the sleeper sofa was older and I had trouble getting up from the sofa. The management was very friendly and helpful. I am disabeled and they took special steps to make my stay pleasant. Can't wait to go back in April '10. Cat Lady, Bixby OK

Reviews.Title: “don't read OLD reviews”
Reviews.Author: oklacupla
Reviews.Content: This hotel must have been updated since some of the reviews are soo old...I had feared we might take one look and leave....but this is a very nice place...It is on hwy76 main drag of Branson but the rooms are way back to the back with Charlie's Grill between office ,pool and rooms...we enjoyed peace and quite and everything we wanted to do was not far....continental breakfast usually means coffee and a hard breakfast roll , maybe... But the Hall of Fame has a special large room in back of their office , big sign BREAKFAST ROOM..even with a patio to eat on ....biscuits and gravy, orange and apple juice coffee, tea , bagels with cream cheese, toast and jelly, french toast with syrup, a choice of several cereals, bowl of fruit salad. We filled up on breakfast and waited till early evening to eat again...Our room was kept sooo clean while we were away that we left the maid a tip...so be sure to check the dates on the reviews before making a choice....we loved it.....and we will go back .....

Reviews.Title: “GREAT and AFFORDABLE”
Reviews.Author: needsdusting
Reviews.Content: This makes several times I have stayed at the Hall of Fame. It is quiet, clean, and very affordable. If you like FANCY, you need to stay elsewhere, but if you only need a place to recover from shopping and shows, it is the place for you. The breakfast is delicious and free. When we asked for more towels, they arrived promptly. It's very convenient on 76, and close to two of the outlet malls. Branson is a great place to go anytime, but I have found April to be the best.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: jeloca
Reviews.Content: The people at the front desk were very nice & friendly. Check in was no problem. Unfortunately, the rooms were dirty. It was evident they hadn't been cleaned properly or recently. Dust covered the microwave, television and dresser. Trash was on the floor behind the bedspread that lay over the bed down to the floor. Make-up was on a pillowcase. The area was quiet and close to the strip. We walked many places. Breakfast consisted of very few things. Recommend going someplace else to eat. Breakfast room was not air conditioned, floor was slippery due to the humidity created, and the lady "supervising" the food was rude. We were able to get wireless internet service from a different hotel while in our rooms until we were kicked off of that, but this hotel does not offer wireless internet even though they said they did.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems at all, very reasonable too!”
Reviews.Author: mmichael171
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hall of Fame for five nights in June 2007. We visit Branson several times each year and wanted somewhere situated on the strip that could allow for some walking. Have two kids, 5 & 6, and a nearly term pregnant wife for this one. Due to that fact the walking did no happen. One negative about the property is the steep incline to walk for breakfast and to the strip. If you don't have a room in the first building in off the strip then the walk is steep. If you have special needs or problems with the inclines then you might talk this over with management if you wish to stay here (my very pregnant wife didn't mind daily walks to the pool, but we drove everywhere else). I have no complaints about the room. It was clean when we arrived, and cleaned each day well. Complimentary soap and shampoo was plentiful as was clean linen, towels, etc. There was no excessive noise from adjacent rooms or outside. As I said about the steep inclines and walking, the same goes for parking in some places. The breakfast was good (inclines again played a role in the wife going; if she went then we drove, if not, the kids and I walked and brought her things back). I really can't complain about this experience. The only time I contacted the desk was for some additional pillows, each Queen bed had two. Within 20 minutes an employee delivered two additional pillows I had requested. The pool was clean and enjoyable. The best thing, with an internet special coupon I got this stay for $49 per night. I would definately stay again. Remember, if you want high end chain motel/hotel amenities, then stay at one. Don't book at a mom and pop then complain when it's not a Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again.....”
Reviews.Author: dhboot88
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nites and it was much less then desirable! I had booked a jacuzzi suite and when we arrived and saw the room I almost cried!! It was at the very back of the resort in a somewhat secluded area. The buildings were very old, and worn...sidewalks were dirty and no where to park safely. the room was dark with only a few recessed lights. no dressers for clothing and no hangers to hang up ! I guess it would be live out of a suitcase all week! the bathroom was disgusting with bugs on the floor and dirty kitchenette... the room had an odor and the carpet filthy and spotted. We went to the desk and they moved us to a double room that had been remodeled and it was acceptable but nothing special. Also the young guy at the front did not know how to adjust the room rate so that was a whole other saga. The management really needs to consider some work to the hotel. It desperately needs some repair and updates. From now on I think we will stick with the best western or the comfort inn or one of the other better known chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with room, service, everything!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a King Jacuzzi Suite (room 6204 to be exact) on our honeymoon. I had read through all the reviews and the negative ones had me a little nervous. I had never stayed at this hotel before, and chose it based on everything that came with the room as well as the price. I was afraid I'd picked a bad place, but I'm pleased to say that I've never been so happy to be wrong! The room was very spacious; the jacuzzi was wonderful. The kitchenette had a mini-fridge with a tiny freezer, a microwave, and even plates and utensils. Being our honeymoon, we had the do-not-disturb sign on the door the entire time. Housekeeping never so much as knocked on our door, but was kind enough to leave us plenty of clean towels and other necessities without us even requesting them. We were a little late checking out on the last day, but that was okay too! The free breakfast was good, the staff was very friendly, and we had a wonderful time. We decided to just stay at the Hall of Fame anytime we come to Branson, because we know we will be treated well. Just like in a marriage, when you find a good thing, you hang on to it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel, I was very impressed with this place. The rooms were very clean and the staff was very friendly. We stayed for three nights and have already booked our next stay in November. The rooms were cleaned very early every morning which was very nice since I was back in our room fairly early in the afternoon, I cant say enough nice things about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here”
Reviews.Author: Travelinganjlofmrc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a jacuzzi suite, the room was spacious. Had a fireplace, would have loved to have used it, it was our 30th anniversary, but it was August. Refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot and a toaster all provided, and were clean. I needed a blow dryer and an iron, both were given to me in less than 10 minutes! Will stay again, and Charlie's steak and grill is in the parking lot, wonderful place to eat, try the pit ham!

Reviews.Title: “Alot to be desired at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place was pretty nice, staff in office were friendly, rooms were nice. However, did not appreciate having to swim with one of the employees kids who had a DOG in the pool. Very unsanitary. Then to top it all off she was using the guest towels to dry the dog. Did not go swimming to swim with the dogs, if I wanted to swim with animals I would go to Florida and swim with the dolphins. And the all time topper, NO HOT WATER to take a shower with at 7:30am. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel numerous times this spring. The Hall of Fame has clean rooms and a friendly staff as well as a convenient location. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “2005, GREAT PLACE For the Family! (Loved It)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel and had a great time, the location is in the middle of everything. If we wanted to we could have walked to about 6 different shows. I am going to make the Hall of Fame a place I stay at every year! Friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our church group stayed in the hotel, November 8-11, 2004. The rooms had been remodeled with microwave and refrigerator in each. Very clean. They have new owners. Don't pay any attention to reviews earlier than June, 2004. Located in the center of Branson and near many shows.

Reviews.Title: “They must have updated....”
Reviews.Author: Sports_Mom_08
Reviews.Content: I must admit that we were a little worried after reading the reviews on your site but we had already booked our rooms. Were we pleasantly surprised when we arrived. We stayed in the newer wing, and everything was great!!! Clean and quiet! My husband and I are VERY picky and we didn't have a complaint! So either they have done a complete upgrade or thoroughly cleaned up the problems!! I'd recommend it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “never recommend this hotel to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hall of Fame Hotel in early November 2003. We have 2 preschool age children and were really looking forward to getting away, just the 2 of us. I was concerned about staying at this hotel from the other reviews I read, but hoped maybe the other reviews were just done by people that were really picky. Plus we were assigned to stay there as part of a vacation ownership presentation deal so........we upgraded to a "condo" and lets say their idea of a condo and mine are definately 2 different things. This was an oversized hotel room with a kitchenette that I was afraid to use because of the uncleanliness, a very small bathroom and a most uncomfortable couch placed next to the bed that looked at a fireplace and a 19inch tv. The heat and air came from the same unit which was like a portable air conditioner/heater which smelled musty when the heat was on. The fireplace didn't work and after arguing with the girl at the front desk she sent up a maintenance man. After about 45 minutes he got the fireplace working and told me that he wasn't sure he'd beable to get it started that many of the fireplaces are old and need to be replaced. The dishwasher in the kitchenette wasn't even connected and stuck out into the the walkway. The bathroom floor was linoleum and all discolored and peeling up. However the shower did have dual shower heads which was nice. The trim was missing from around the inside of the bathroom door and you could see all the dust and cobwebs built up in there. There was something pink on the wall above the toilet paper holder and we were scared at the thought of what it could be. If all of this wasn't enough, there was a nice size closet to put your clothes in, but of course there were no hangers in there. I wouldn't stay at this place again if it was free, but come on this is Branson there are plenty of other hotels to stay at that are cheaper and nicer. I'm grateful I didn't pay a dime for this place, yet at the same time I would of rather spent my own money and stayed somewhere respectable. I'm not asking for a lot, just something clean and kept up. If you are looking for something clean and kept up as well, do not stay at Hall of Fame Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, beds were not made and room was not cleaned”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was filthy. Carpet was the dirtiest I have ever seen. Like another reviewer stated, the carpet would make your feet black. The room was not cleaned and beds were not made in the morning. Wash cloths were dirty. Grounds were in bad shape. Motel is very old. Sheets were torn. Hairdryer was not included in the room. I tried many times to call and confirm our reservation and calls were NEVER answered. I tried calling from our room several times to ask for additional towels, and again, calls were never answered. Styrofoam cups for coffee maker were not individually wrapped. Room was musty smelling. I would not advise anyone to stay at this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are frequent visitors of Branson and we love the Hall of Fame. We were very surprised to read the bad reviews because we were just there on July 25, 2003 and had another wonderful stay. We enjoy the huge free breakfast, the quiet and very clean rooms, and the friendly staff. We have never been treated as well anywhere else except at the Hall of Fame. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone and everyone!

Reviews.Title: “dirty dirty dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The carpets in our room were so dirty our feet turned black from walking across them. It was disgusting! We contacted management and they were not responsive to our complaints. We cancelled our next two nights and stayed elsewhere. If you are gonna stay here, bring your carpet cleaner so you can take your shoes off.

HotelInfo.Name: Hall of Fame Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 3005 West 76 Highway, Branson, MO 65616
